roleset.name: un-associate, making unrelated, separating
roleset.note: DISSOCIATE-V NOTES: The first two usages seem to be specialized and mean something like'fall apart'. (from dissociate.01-v)

example.name: oddly ergative
example.text: When an electric current is applied to the palladium and platinum electrodes, [the heavy water]-3 did begin [*-3]to break up, or dissociate.

example.name: transitive
example.text: It-2 would go along [*-2]-3 doing nothing but [*-3]dissociating the heavy water and then at totally unpredictable times, it would begin producing excess heat for as long as 10 or 11 hours before quieting down.

example.name: more normal usage
example.text: John dissociated himself from Mary's band of thugs.

example.name: without causer
example.text: Whether Iranian courts have ordered persons who have been associated of Baha'is to publicly announce their dissociation from their former Baha'i associates...
